network_overview: The capture contains only 4 packets (215 bytes) exchanged between two private subnets—an HTTP/TCP three-way handshake on 192.168.1.0/24 and a single UDP datagram on 10.0.0.0/24—showing no mobile-specific signalling or user-plane traffic (GTP-U, Diameter, NGAP, S1-AP, SIP, PFCP) and therefore no active subscriber sessions.

observations.finding: Extremely low packet count (4) and sub-millisecond duration indicate the trace was sliced at the very start of a longer session or captured with an aggressive snap-length/bpf filter.
No GTP-C/U, Diameter, NGAP, S1-AP, SIP, RTP, or PFCP detected; traffic is purely best-effort TCP/UDP between RFC1918 hosts—no evidence of 3GPP interfaces.
TCP flow completed SYN-SYN/ACK-ACK (flags S-SA-A) in 1.7 ms, RTT ≈ 0.85 ms—local LAN-like latency, no retransmissions, window scale ok.
Single 53-byte UDP frame (ports 5000→6000) could be proprietary keep-alive or measurement probe; payload not decoded.

recommendations.action: Extend capture window to at least 30 s and include 3GPP bearer interfaces (S1-U, S5, N3, N4) to verify VoLTE/5GS user-plane.
recommendations.rationale: Current snapshot is too short to observe GTP tunnel setup or SIP session establishment.

recommendations.action: Enable GTP, PFCP, Diameter, SIP and NGAP decoder preferences in the capture tool to allow accurate technology classification.
recommendations.rationale: Ensures control- and user-plane packets are dissected instead of showing 'Unknown'.

recommendations.action: Filter simultaneously on UDP-L4 ports 2123, 2152, 8805, 3868, 36412, 36422, 5060, 5061 to isolate mobile signalling during problem reproduction.
recommendations.rationale: Reduces background noise and focuses analysis on relevant 3GPP protocols.

session_analysis.signaling_health: No control-plane protocols observed; GTP-C, Diameter, SIP, NGAP, S1-AP counters zero.
session_analysis.user_plane_health: No GTP-U or RTP streams detected; user-plane throughput 0 kbps.
session_analysis.cross_plane_correlation: No bearer or SIP dialogs present, therefore no correlation possible.

sequence_diagram:
sequenceDiagram
    participant Client as 192.168.1.1:1234
    participant Server as 192.168.1.2:80
    Note over Client,Server: TCP 3-way handshake only
    Client->>Server: SYN seq=x
    Server->>Client: SYN-ACK seq=y ack=x+1
    Client->>Server: ACK seq=x+1 ack=y+1
    Note right of Server: No HTTP GET seen (snap end)
